recipes.title: Pesarattu with Ginger Chutney
recipes.description: A protein-rich pancake made with green gram, served with a tangy ginger chutney.
steps: Soak green gram and rice (optional) for 4-6 hours.
Grind soaked ingredients with green chili, ginger, and salt into a smooth batter.
Heat a skillet, pour batter, and spread thinly.
Drizzle oil and cook until golden on both sides.
Serve hot with ginger chutney.

recipes.title: Upma Pesarattu
recipes.description: A delightful combination of upma served with protein-rich pesarattu.
steps: Prepare pesarattu batter by soaking and grinding green gram, rice, and chili.
Cook upma separately and keep it aside.
Make thin pesarattu pancakes and place a portion of upma on top.
Fold the pancake and serve hot.

recipes.title: Idli with Karivepaku Chutney
recipes.description: Steamed rice cakes paired with flavorful curry leaf chutney.
steps: Steam the idlis using the batter.
For chutney, blend curry leaves, chilies, coconut, tamarind, and salt into a smooth paste.
Serve the idlis with karivepaku chutney.

recipes.title: Andhra-style Dosa with Peanut Chutney
recipes.description: Crispy dosa served with creamy peanut chutney.
steps: Prepare dosa by spreading batter thinly on a hot skillet.
Blend peanuts, coconut, chili, and salt into a smooth chutney.
Serve dosa hot with peanut chutney.

recipes.title: Uggani with Mirchi Bajji
recipes.description: Soft rice puff paired with spicy chili fritters.
steps: Soak puffed rice briefly and squeeze out water.
Cook with onions, chili, turmeric, and salt.
Prepare batter with gram flour, coat chilies, and deep fry to make bajjis.
Serve uggani with mirchi bajjis.

recipes.title: Punugulu
recipes.description: Crispy fritters made from rice batter.
steps: Mix chopped onions and chili with dosa batter.
Heat oil and drop small portions of batter to deep fry until golden.
Serve with chutney or ketchup.

recipes.title: Karam Dosa
recipes.description: Spicy dosa topped with chili powder and onions.
steps: Spread dosa batter thinly on a skillet.
Sprinkle chili powder and onions on top.
Drizzle oil and cook until crispy.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Rava Dosa with Allam Chutney
recipes.description: Thin, crispy semolina dosa served with ginger chutney.
ingredients: For chutney: 1 tbsp grated ginger, tamarind, green chili
steps: Prepare a thin batter with rava, rice flour, and all-purpose flour.
Cook dosa on a hot skillet until crispy.
Blend ginger, tamarind, and chili into chutney.
Serve together.

recipes.title: Semiya Upma with Coconut Chutney
recipes.description: Savory vermicelli upma served with coconut chutney.
steps: Roast semiya and cook with onions and chili.
Prepare chutney by blending grated coconut and salt.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Poha with Tamarind and Peanuts
recipes.description: Flattened rice flavored with tamarind and crunchy peanuts.
steps: Soak poha and drain.
Cook with tamarind paste, turmeric, and peanuts.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Bobbatlu
recipes.description: Sweet lentil flatbread flavored with ghee.
steps: Cook and mash chana dal, mix with jaggery to form filling.
Make dough from wheat flour and roll into small discs.
Fill discs with dal-jaggery mixture, seal, and roll again.
Cook on a skillet with ghee until golden.

recipes.title: Minapa Roti
recipes.description: Crispy urad dal dosa served with chutney.
steps: Soak urad dal and rice for 4-6 hours.
Grind into a smooth batter with chili and salt.
Cook dosa on a skillet until crispy.
Serve with chutney.

recipes.title: Ragi Sankati with Peanut Chutney
recipes.description: A healthy ragi dish served with spicy peanut chutney.
steps: Boil water, add ragi flour gradually, and stir to avoid lumps.
Cook until thickened and smooth.
Prepare chutney by grinding peanuts and spices.
Serve together.

recipes.title: Andhra-style Pongal with Ghee
recipes.description: Soft pongal rice flavored with spices and ghee.
steps: Cook rice and dal together until soft.
Heat ghee, add pepper and cumin, and mix with cooked rice.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Garelu (Medu Vada) with Sambar
recipes.description: Crispy lentil fritters served with flavorful sambar.
steps: Soak and grind urad dal into a smooth batter.
Shape batter into small doughnuts and deep fry until golden.
Serve with hot sambar.

recipes.title: Pappu Charu (Dal Rasam) with Steamed Rice
recipes.description: A tangy dal rasam made with tamarind and spices, served with steamed rice.
steps: Cook toor dal with enough water in a pressure cooker.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and green chili.
Add chopped tomato and cook until soft.
Add tamarind pulp, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt to the mixture.
Add the cooked dal to the pan and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Gongura Pachadi with Hot Rice
recipes.description: Tangy and spicy gongura chutney served with hot rice.
steps: In a pan, heat oil and sauté mustard seeds, fenugreek, dried red chilies, and sesame seeds.
Add the gongura leaves and cook until they wilt and release moisture.
Add tamarind pulp, salt, and cook until the mixture thickens.
Blend the chutney into a coarse paste and serve with hot rice.

recipes.title: Pulasa Pulusu
recipes.description: A seasonal delicacy, Andhra-style fish curry made with tamarind and spices.
steps: Marinate the fish with turmeric and red chili powder for 15 minutes.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions, tomatoes, and ginger-garlic paste until golden.
Add tamarind pulp and salt, cook for 5 minutes.
Add the fish pieces and cook until they are tender and the curry thickens.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with rice.

recipes.title: Royyala Iguru (Prawn Curry) with Rice
recipes.description: Spicy and flavorful prawn curry served with steamed rice.
steps: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, onions, and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes, cook until soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, tamarind pulp, and salt.
Add prawns and cook until they are tender and the curry thickens.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Gutti Vankaya Kura with Jowar Roti
recipes.description: Stuffed brinjal curry cooked in a rich, spicy masala, paired with jowar roti.
steps: Roast peanuts and sesame seeds, grind them into a coarse powder.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard and cumin seeds.
Sauté onions and tomatoes until soft.
Stuff the brinjals with the ground paste and add them to the pan.
Cook until brinjals are tender and the curry is thick.
Serve with jowar roti.

recipes.title: Andhra Chepala Pulusu
recipes.description: Traditional Andhra-style fish curry made with tamarind and aromatic spices.
steps: In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste until golden.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add tamarind pulp and cook for 5 minutes.
Add fish pieces and simmer until the fish is cooked through.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Mamidikaya Pappu (Raw Mango Dal) with Rice
recipes.description: Tangy raw mango dal paired with hot steamed rice.
steps: Cook toor dal with water and raw mango pieces.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and green chili.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add the cooked dal and mango, simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Avakaya Annam (Rice Mixed with Mango Pickle)
recipes.description: Simple and tangy rice dish mixed with traditional mango pickle.
steps: In a pan, heat ghee and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida.
Add cooked rice and mix well with mango pickle.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Ulava Charu (Horse Gram Stew) with Rice
recipes.description: A hearty and nutritious horse gram stew served with hot rice.
steps: Soak horse gram overnight and cook it in a pressure cooker.
In a pan, heat oil, sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add turmeric, cumin powder, tamarind pulp, and salt.
Add cooked horse gram and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Chicken Pulao Andhra-style
recipes.description: Aromatic and flavorful Andhra-style chicken pulao.
steps: Heat oil, sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, garam masala, red chili powder, and chicken pieces.
Cook chicken until tender.
Add rice, water, and salt, and cook until rice is done.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Miriyala Rasam (Pepper Rasam) with Rice
recipes.description: Spicy pepper rasam served with hot steamed rice.
steps: Cook toor dal in a pressure cooker.
In a pan, heat ghee, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and black pepper.
Add tomatoes, tamarind pulp, and cooked dal, simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

recipes.title: Kakarakaya Fry (Bitter Gourd Fry) with Rice
recipes.description: Crispy bitter gourd fry served with steamed rice.
steps: Slice bitter gourds and remove seeds.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions.
Add bitter gourd slices, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Fry until crispy and golden.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Kodi Pulusu (Chicken Curry) with Rice
recipes.description: Traditional spicy chicken curry paired with hot steamed rice.
steps: Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions, and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add chicken and cook until it is tender.
Add tamarind pulp and simmer until the curry thickens.
Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Tomato Pappu (Tomato Dal) with Steamed Rice
recipes.description: Simple and flavorful tomato dal served with steamed rice.
steps: Cook toor dal with water and tomatoes.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions, green chili, and turmeric.
Add cooked dal and salt, simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Gongura Mutton with Rice
recipes.description: Rich and tangy mutton curry made with gongura leaves, served with rice.
steps: Cook mutton with turmeric powder and salt in a pressure cooker.
Heat oil, sauté onions, tomatoes, and ginger-garlic paste.
Add cooked mutton and gongura leaves, cook until thick.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Mirchi Bajji (Stuffed Chili Fritters)
recipes.description: Spicy and tangy green chilies stuffed with tangy filling, dipped in batter, and deep-fried.
steps: Slit the green chilies lengthwise and remove the seeds.
Stuff them with tamarind chutney.
Prepare a batter by mixing chickpea flour, carom seeds, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Dip the stuffed chilies into the batter and fry them until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney.

recipes.title: Punugulu (Deep-Fried Rice Batter Fritters)
recipes.description: Crispy fritters made from fermented rice batter, deep-fried to perfection.
steps: In a bowl, mix rice flour, fermented rice, chopped chili, onions, coriander, and salt.
Add water if necessary to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan.
Shape the batter into small balls and fry them until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney.

recipes.title: Garelu (Medu Vada)
recipes.description: Crispy fried lentil fritters, soft inside and crunchy outside.
steps: Soak urad dal for 4-6 hours and grind it into a smooth batter.
Mix the batter with chopped onions, green chilies, cumin, asafoetida, and salt.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Wet your hands, take a small amount of batter, form a ring shape, and drop it into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Serve with coconut chutney or sambar.

recipes.title: Bandar Laddu (Sweet Made of Besan)
recipes.description: A traditional sweet made with roasted besan (gram flour) and sugar.
ingredients: Chopped cashews and almonds for garnish
steps: Roast the besan in ghee until it turns golden brown and aromatic.
In a separate pan, dissolve sugar in water and bring it to a single thread consistency.
Add the sugar syrup to the roasted besan, mix well, and cook for a few minutes.
Shape the mixture into small laddus and garnish with chopped nuts.
Allow the laddus to cool and set.

recipes.title: Boorelu (Sweet Stuffed Dumplings)
recipes.description: Sweet dumplings stuffed with jaggery and coconut, deep-fried in ghee.
steps: Soak urad dal for 2-3 hours and grind it into a smooth batter.
Prepare a stuffing by mixing jaggery, grated coconut, and cardamom powder.
Form small balls of dough, stuff them with the coconut-jaggery mixture, and seal the edges.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the dumplings until golden brown.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Nuvvula Chekkalu (Sesame Rice Crackers)
recipes.description: Crispy and crunchy sesame and rice flour crackers.
steps: In a bowl, mix rice flour, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Add water and knead into a stiff dough.
Roll the dough into thin discs and prick with a fork to prevent puffing.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the crackers until golden and crispy.
Allow them to cool before serving.

recipes.title: Palakayalu (Crispy Rice Flour Desserts)
recipes.description: Crunchy and crispy rice flour-based snack, fried to perfection.
steps: Mix rice flour, chickpea flour, cumin seeds, sesame seeds, and salt in a bowl.
Add water gradually and knead into a smooth dough.
Roll out the dough into thin sheets and cut them into small squares.
Fry the pieces in hot oil until crispy and golden.
Serve as a snack.

recipes.title: Pappu Chekkalu (Lentil Crackers)
recipes.description: Crispy and savory lentil-based crackers, ideal for a quick snack.
steps: Soak moong dal for 3-4 hours, then grind it coarsely.
Mix the ground dal, rice flour, cumin seeds, turmeric, and salt.
Add water and knead into a dough.
Roll out the dough into thin discs and fry them in hot oil until crispy.
Serve as a snack.

recipes.title: Gongura Punugulu (Spinach Fritters)
recipes.description: Fritters made with gongura (sorrel) leaves and rice batter.
steps: Mix rice flour, fermented rice batter, gongura leaves, green chili, onions, and salt.
Shape the mixture into small fritters.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the fritters until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney.

recipes.title: Ariselu (Sweet Rice Flour Patties)
recipes.description: Sweet rice flour patties made with jaggery, deep-fried to golden perfection.
steps: Dissolve jaggery in water and cook it until it forms a single thread consistency.
Mix rice flour and cardamom powder into the jaggery syrup.
Shape the mixture into small patties.
Fry them in hot oil until golden brown.
Serve hot as a sweet treat.

recipes.title: Andhra Chicken Curry with Chapati
recipes.description: Spicy and flavorful Andhra-style chicken curry served with soft chapatis.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, and red chili powder, cooking until oil separates.
Add chicken pieces and salt, mix well, and cook for 10 minutes.
Add yogurt and garam masala, cover, and simmer until the chicken is tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with chapati.

recipes.title: Ragi Sankati with Natu Kodi Pulusu (Chicken Stew with Ragi Mudde)
recipes.description: Nutritious ragi mudde paired with a spicy country chicken stew.
steps: Boil water with salt and gradually add ragi flour, stirring continuously.
Cook until it forms a thick consistency and shape into balls (mudde).
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices, cooking until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces, mix well, and cook until tender.
Serve the chicken stew hot with ragi mudde.

recipes.title: Gongura Pappu with Steamed Rice
recipes.description: Tangy lentil curry made with gongura leaves, perfect with steamed rice.
steps: Cook toor dal with green chilies and turmeric until soft.
In a separate pan, sauté gongura leaves until wilted.
Mash the dal and mix it with the gongura leaves.
Prepare a tempering with mustard seeds, dried chilies, and oil. Add to the dal.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Tomato Pachadi with Rice and Ghee
recipes.description: Tangy tomato chutney served with hot rice and a dollop of ghee.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté tomatoes and green chilies until soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Mash or blend into a coarse chutney.
Serve with rice and ghee.

recipes.title: Kodi Vepudu with Steamed Rice (Andhra-Style Chicken Fry)
recipes.description: Spicy and crispy chicken fry, a perfect complement to steamed rice.
steps: Marinate chicken with turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and fry chicken until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with curry leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Biryani with Gongura Chutney
recipes.description: Fragrant biryani paired with tangy gongura chutney.
ingredients: Fresh coriander and mint for garnish
steps: Cook basmati rice until 80% done and set aside.
Marinate chicken/mutton with spices and yogurt.
Layer rice and marinated meat in a pot, topping with fried onions and herbs.
Cook on low heat until the meat is tender.
Serve biryani hot with gongura chutney.

recipes.title: Gutti Vankaya Kura with Chapati (Stuffed Brinjal Curry)
recipes.description: Flavorful stuffed brinjal curry, perfect with chapati or rice.
steps: Prepare a paste with peanuts, sesame seeds, chili powder, turmeric, and tamarind.
Stuff the brinjals with the prepared paste.
Heat oil in a pan, add stuffed brinjals, and cook on low heat until tender.
Add the remaining paste and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with chapati.

recipes.title: Pesarapappu Charu with Rice (Moong Dal Rasam)
recipes.description: Light and comforting moong dal rasam served with rice.
steps: Cook moong dal with green chilies and turmeric until soft.
Mash the dal and add tamarind pulp and salt.
Prepare a tempering with mustard seeds, dried chilies, and curry leaves. Add to the dal.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.title: Ulava Charu with Fresh Cream and Idli (Horse Gram Stew)
recipes.description: Rich horse gram stew served with fresh cream and soft idlis.
steps: Soak horse gram overnight and pressure cook until soft.
Extract the juice and mix with tamarind pulp, turmeric, and chili powder.
Simmer the mixture for 10 minutes, adjusting salt to taste.
Serve hot with fresh cream and idli.

recipes.title: Chapati with Allam Pachadi (Ginger Chutney)
recipes.description: Soft chapati paired with spicy and tangy ginger chutney.
steps: Knead wheat flour, water, and salt into a soft dough. Roll into chapatis and cook on a hot pan.
Blend ginger, jaggery, green chilies, and tamarind into a chutney.
Prepare a tempering with mustard seeds and add to the chutney.
Serve chapati hot with allam pachadi.

recipes.title: Royyala Vepudu with Rice (Andhra-Style Prawn Fry)
recipes.description: Spicy Andhra-style prawn fry served with steamed rice.
steps: Marinate prawns with turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté prawns until cooked.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with curry leaves.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.title: Kandi Pachadi with Hot Rice (Toor Dal Chutney)
recipes.description: Earthy toor dal chutney served with hot rice.
steps: Dry roast toor dal, red chilies, and cumin seeds until aromatic.
Grind with tamarind pulp and salt into a coarse chutney.
Prepare a tempering with curry leaves and add to the chutney.
Serve with hot rice.

recipes.title: Andhra-Style Fish Pulusu with Rice
recipes.description: Tangy and spicy fish curry served with steamed rice.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy.
Mix in turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt.
Add tamarind pulp and 2 cups of water. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Gently add fish pieces and simmer for 15–20 minutes until the fish is cooked through and the flavors meld.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Avakaya Annam with Papad (Rice Mixed with Mango Pickle)
recipes.description: Simple and flavorful rice mixed with tangy mango pickle, paired with crispy papad.
steps: Take warm steamed rice in a mixing bowl.
Add Avakaya (mango pickle) to the rice and mix gently to coat the rice evenly.
Optionally, drizzle ghee or sesame oil for added flavor.
Serve immediately with crispy fried or roasted papads on the side.

recipes.title: Nellore Mutton Curry with Steamed Rice
recipes.description: Spicy and aromatic Nellore-style mutton curry served with rice.
steps: Heat oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes, cooking until oil separates.
Add mutton, spices, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add water and simmer until mutton is tender.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice.

recipes.title: Gulab Jamun
recipes.description: Soft and spongy fried milk-based dumplings soaked in aromatic sugar syrup.
steps: Mix khoya, all-purpose flour, and baking powder to form a soft dough.
Shape the dough into small balls.
Heat oil and fry the balls until golden brown.
Prepare sugar syrup by boiling water, sugar, and cardamom powder.
Soak the fried balls in syrup and serve warm.

recipes.title: Rasgulla
recipes.description: Soft and spongy cheese balls soaked in a light sugar syrup.
steps: Boil milk and add lemon juice to curdle it.
Strain the curds and knead into a smooth dough.
Shape into small balls and boil in sugar syrup for 15 minutes.
Cool and serve chilled with rose water.

recipes.title: Rasmalai
recipes.description: Soft paneer discs soaked in sweetened milk flavored with saffron and cardamom.
steps: Prepare paneer discs from paneer dough and cook in sugar syrup.
Boil milk until reduced to half, add sugar, cardamom, and saffron.
Soak the paneer discs in the sweetened milk.
Chill and serve garnished with nuts.

recipes.title: Laddu
recipes.description: Traditional Indian sweet made with gram flour, ghee, and sugar.
steps: Roast gram flour in ghee until aromatic.
Mix sugar and cardamom powder into the roasted flour.
Shape into laddus while warm and garnish with nuts.

recipes.title: Kalakand
recipes.description: Rich and moist Indian sweet made with condensed milk and paneer.
steps: Cook paneer and condensed milk in a pan until thickened.
Add sugar and cardamom powder and mix well.
Spread the mixture in a greased tray and garnish with nuts.
Let it set and cut into pieces before serving.

recipes.title: Mysore Pak
recipes.description: Buttery and rich Indian fudge made with gram flour, sugar, and ghee.
steps: Prepare sugar syrup with sugar and water to one-thread consistency.
Gradually add roasted gram flour and mix well.
Slowly pour ghee and cook until the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.
Pour into a greased tray, let it set, and cut into pieces.

recipes.title: Jalebi
recipes.description: Crispy and spiral-shaped Indian sweet soaked in sugar syrup.
steps: Prepare a batter with flour, yogurt, and baking powder. Ferment for 8 hours.
Pipe the batter into hot oil in spiral shapes and fry until golden.
Soak the jalebis in sugar syrup infused with saffron and serve.

recipes.title: Kheer
recipes.description: Creamy rice pudding flavored with cardamom and saffron.
steps: Cook rice in milk on low heat until soft.
Add sugar, cardamom, and saffron and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with nuts and serve warm or chilled.

recipes.title: Apricot Delight
recipes.description: A rich and tangy dessert made with apricots and cream.
steps: Soak apricots in water overnight and blend into a smooth paste.
Cook the apricot paste with sugar until thickened.
Layer with fresh cream and garnish with nuts before serving.

recipes.title: Ice Creams
recipes.description: Homemade creamy ice creams in various flavors.
ingredients: Flavoring of choice (vanilla, chocolate, mango, etc.)
steps: Heat milk and sugar until dissolved.
Mix in heavy cream and your chosen flavoring.
Freeze the mixture, stirring every hour for a creamy texture.
Serve chilled.
